thread.title: 'They tried to get me': Stock-market millionaire narrowly escapes violent carjacking in Rolls-Royce
thread.title_full: 'They tried to get me': Stock-market millionaire narrowly escapes violent carjacking in Rolls-Royce

author: Saphora Smith
title: 'They tried to get me': Stock-market millionaire narrowly escapes violent carjacking in Rolls-Royce
text:
How to make the perfect bouquet for Valentine's Day 
A self-taught stock-market millionaire narrowly escaped a violent carjacking as he drove around south London in his Rolls-Royce. 
Elijah Oyefeso, 22, who has an array of supercars, claimed he was attacked on the South Circular in the early hours of Friday morning. 
He told the Standard: “I was driving through Forest Hill on the way back to Southampton from Edgware Road , it was around 2.45am, when a car hit me from behind and another swerved in front of me boxing me in. 
“One guy then came out of the car and covered his face with his arm. 
"He started smashing the passenger window with a metal pole. Then another guy came and started smashing mine in. Smashed drivers-seat window (Elijah Oyefeso) 
“Luckily the car has double glazing and I managed to accelerate away, bumping the other car out of the way.” 
The 22-year-old has several supercars (@elijah_oezz) 
Dramatic footage, taken shortly after the incident, showed Mr Oyefeso saying: “They tried to get me, they tried to get me, look, they tried to get me, but I’m still here.” 
The video showed his electric blue Rolls Royce with smashed windows and a damaged bumper guard. Smashed interior of the car 
Police confirmed the incident had been reported but could not give any further details. 
Mr Oyefeso hit headlines in 2015 after he revealed he’d used his student loan to make tens of thousands of pounds a month by investing in stocks and shares. Smashed door (Elijah Oyefeso) 
Mr Oyefeso, from Southampton, went to the University of Buckingham to study business management but dropped out after successfully investing his student loan in stocks. 
He now lives the high life in London boasting a range of expensive cars and watches including Mercedes, Lamborghini and Bentley and a £21,000 Cartier watch.
